bibdata.title: American National Standard Instrumentation and Systems for Monitoring Airborne Radioactivity
American National Standard Instrumentation and Systems for Monitoring Airborne Radioactivity

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: The complexity associated with quantitative assay and monitoring of aerosols and gasses can be substantial. This standard covers system design, manufacture, performance, testing, calibration, and maintenance requirements for noble gases, aerosols (including transuranics), tritium, and radioiodides.

The complexity associated with quantitative assay and monitoring of aerosols and gasses can be substantial. This standard covers system design, manufacture, performance, testing, calibration, and maintenance requirements for noble gases, aerosols (including transuranics), tritium, and radioiodides.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
